website_summaries.verdict: With a fast brewing time and a micro-filter, this AeroPress coffee maker will produce a very smooth cup of gourmet coffee or espresso in as little as one minute. Super easy to clean, and includes bonus filters and a tote bag for travel.
pros: Works well with lower water temperatures for a cold brew or coffee concentrate
Only requires a quick rinse between uses
Brewed coffee has very low acidity
cons: Plastic components are opaque, not clear
Requires a generous amount of coffee for best results
Seams are sharp, and prone to leakage

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for at home or on the road
customer_reviews.text: Perfect product. Easy to use, easy to take along, easy to clean, and so many ways to make coffee. Came with the extra filters, and the bag also (everything in the pic). The bag is worth it if you want to take your aeropress on the road, it’s perfectly sized to fit the whole system in it and why not
customer_reviews.author: A.h

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Coffee... wishing for more quantity
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical that a hunk of plastic tubing could give me an excellent cup of coffee, but now I have converted to pro-AeroPress. When you follow the directions, pushing down slowly and evenly, the brew is freaking awesome --- rich, buttery, chocolaty, stout, and delicious. I bought it for my vacation later this month --- the condo we stay at has a Black and Decker ancient drip machine --- but I find myself using my AeroPress more than my single-cup Ninja (which I love).
customer_reviews.author: Meathead

customer_reviews.title: What the hell is blending power?
customer_reviews.text: So yeah I love this thing, I use it every day. The filters are more environmentally friendly than full coffee filters. If you want to go all the way, there are stainless steel filters that are reusable. I find the coffee is slightly more bitter when using them, but not too bad. Otherwise this thing is super easy to use, add filter, add coffee, add water, mix, then plunge. Life is good. I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: John C.

customer_reviews.title: Extremely versatile and ingenious!!!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this Aero Press, it does make a great cup of coffee. It’s a very simple design, easy to clean just rinse and dry. The filters work great and not a single ground bypasses the filter into your cup!!! I bought it for when I’m flying, I’m a Freightdog and we have a galley coffee pot but you have to use special coffee pods. With the Aero Press I can make my favorite coffee on the plane! It is a lot more steps than just picking up a canter and pour but it does the job!
customer_reviews.author: Bigg Robb

customer_reviews.title: Haversack
customer_reviews.text: Great product well made perfect size for all your equipment for a quick joint into the woods! ‘This is my second one I also have one in Florida with the same safety equipment. This a well made product and always have it in my truck just in case!.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald E. Richard

customer_reviews.title: I make coffee with it every day.
customer_reviews.text: Makes a nice pretentious single serivng of coffee, pretty fast. Cleanup is easy. If you follow the directions coffee will be weak, so ignore them. For stronger coffee just add about another scoop, let it steep a little, and don't dilute much. Its great for travel, taking to work or whatever and durable. Electric kettle with pour over spout is ideal, and much harder to make a mess with by accident.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: The way to drink coffee
customer_reviews.text: I love it love it love it. When I make a Keurig now, it just doesn’t taste as good. Same goes for the pour over. AeroPress is so easy, quick, and however this voodoo magic works, results in a smooth, rich cup. I like it dark and chocolatey, and I can top off with hot water to hit just the flavor profile I’m looking for. This came with an extra set of paper filters beyond the standard pack (so nearly 700). You can rinse the paper and use it again - I’m no perfect purist! Pop the grounds puck out, rinse, air dry. Done. Done? Done.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: I'M IN LOVE. I have a Keurig
customer_reviews.text: I'M IN LOVE. I have a Keurig, a Tasimmo, a normal drip brewer and was doing research on a good French press before stumbling upon the Aeropress. I was looking for something I could take with me on all my travels and this seemed to fit the bill as far as being light and compact. I was skeptical on the quality of coffee it would produce being that it looked like such a simple device. HOLY COW, this thing blew me away from my first sip of Sumatra! This is the ONLY way I like to make my coffee now. Clean up also could NOT be easier. A+ all around.
customer_reviews.author: neex112

customer_reviews.title: Best little coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: This one was a gift. This is so great for traveling, get an instant hot water kettle and your own good coffee and you’re set for great coffee in your room. Also great at home for those single cups. You can reuse the filters quite a few times, just rinse and reuse or let dry. I saw this on YouTube review and tried it, wow I had been throwing away each time! Overall great little coffee maker. Get one!
customer_reviews.author: yvonne williams

customer_reviews.title: Makes great coffee
customer_reviews.text: It takes some time to prepare and clean, but it makes a great cup. Keep in mind that your grind and your water temp will have a lot to do with your brew. If the water is too hot it extracts the acid from the beans and tastes like regular coffee. Buying a good quality hot water pot with adjustable temp settings is essential to getting the most out of the AeroPress. Coincidentally Aerobie also makes great discs golf discs, in case you need something to do after you're highly caffeinated.
customer_reviews.author: S.

customer_reviews.title: I love this coffeemaker.
customer_reviews.text: This makes the best cup of coffee ever!! I have had many coffeemakers over the years but this is the best and the easiest to use and clean. Thank you to the man who invented it for his wife. He truly knew what he was doing. I read about it and thought I'd give it a try and it lives up to what was written about it.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce A. Wenker

customer_reviews.title: Who Needs Starbucks???
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my daughter as a gift, and she loves it. She enjoys good coffee, and with this press she can make her own every morning at home. The press also travels well! It comes with a small travel bag with makes it easy to take with you. She even took it camping with some friends, and they all loved it! Highly Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jamel Anderson

customer_reviews.title: This simply will make one of the smoothest cup of coffee you will ever taste!
customer_reviews.text: This device will make the smoothest and richest cup of coffee you have ever tasted! I use the inverted method and there are many videos online that show different ways to use this device! Very easy to clean and makes a single cup in about 2 to 3 minutes once you have your water heated up. There is a reason the aeropress is loved and used by serious coffee connoisseurs all around the world! Such a simple little device that is small and can be used anywhere!
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Super fine coffee
customer_reviews.text: Great value! I tilt mine upside down then fill with coffee and hot water then stir (so some doesn’t seep out thru filter when stirring). I also use fine ground coffee and grind right before brewing. I stir for 15-20 seconds. I get a great crema on top of my coffee and it is the best damn coffee Ive had in my life. Buy it!
customer_reviews.author: ALEX C.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for a couple of months now, and I LOVE it! Coffee comes out the same every single day. No grittiness at all. Coffee just tastes pure and smooth. Best with cold fresh filtered water. I've had no problems with it at all. Only downside is if you're making coffee for more that one person - I go back to my OXO drip brewer for that, which I also love, but carafe can get build up inside pretty quickly.
customer_reviews.author: PetraD

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee, but you'll use a lot of it
customer_reviews.text: Make a mistake, that my review is anything less than five stars is no reflection on the quality of coffee this produces, which is outstanding. The reason that I give this four stars, and the reason we have stopped using it in favor of (sorry) a Keurig is the amount of coffee that it takes to produce a single cup. To do it right, this uses at least twice and usually three times as much coffee as a truly necessary. Plus, any savings you might get over more expensive prepackaged coffee are lost.
customer_reviews.author: John G

customer_reviews.title: Millionaire tastes on a budget wallet
customer_reviews.text: I have a melitta, stovetop espressor maker, drip maker, and this product - an AeroPress. The AeroPress is by far my favorite method for coffee. As a connoisseur of coffee for many years, I've had it made every which way.The result is a smooth-cup, with a strong flavor profile and many of the notes of a "real" espresso.Unless you're shelling out big bucks for the real-deal espresso maker, this is what you want. If you learn to make it just right, you even get a perfect cup with the crema on the top.
customer_reviews.author: Edwardo Lindeloff

customer_reviews.title: The damn thing works!
customer_reviews.text: It's such a stupidly simple design but it works and works well. I also bought the metal filters and am so happy with using those filters that I'll probably never open the paper ones. I can't get over what a good cup of coffee it produces.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Bourrut

customer_reviews.title: I use it every day.
customer_reviews.text: I use this thing every day. I was looking for a fast single serve coffee option for a long time (that wasn’t K-Cup-like). Combine this with an electric kettle and it’s super fast and easy. It might take two minutes out of my morning. I used it for an entire year in Afghanistan, it travels well and is very durable. Now I go to work every morning with coffee from home and no longer stop to pay for a cup. I generally use Bustelo or Gevalia Espresso grind with it, but have used a few dozen types of coffee, always with great success.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Love my AreoPress!
customer_reviews.text: I love making a cup of coffee with this device! Super simple, great tasting coffee & easy cleanup. Also, like that it will be wonderful to take on camping trips.
customer_reviews.author: V. Schopmeyer

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Clean up is a bit of a mess, you will have a dribble or two of coffee sneak out, or from pushing slightly too fast it will bubble up around the filter but this dose make one good cup of coffee. We use this more then our K-Cup machine because it has a richer more fuller flavor. The plastic has microcracks in it, but does not leak. It has lasted well over two years and it still works as good as the day we got it. Our French Press of course makes a purer cup of coffee as none of the oils gets trapped in a filter but this is a good second place.
customer_reviews.author: anthony2823Top Contributor: Lego

customer_reviews.title: Great invention for coffee lovers
customer_reviews.text: I spent a lot of time looking for convenient and coffee makers. I started off with K-cups but I found that the coffee was not great quality and not strong enough. Then we got a nespresso machine and that was actually quite good. The problem is that you're spending on average $.60 per coffee. This little machine is amazing. You get the highest quality coffee. You can tinker with the process to give you different results. I can carry it with me when I travel. I'm definitely converted to the Aeropress coffee maker
customer_reviews.author: ThePimpest.com

customer_reviews.title: Best Coffee Maker Available
customer_reviews.text: By far the best coffee maker I’ve ever owned and I’ve tried most of them. I do not even have a drip pot anymore and any other maker stays in the cabinet. I use it daily no matter where I’m at. It packs very easily no matter if you are backpacking, camping or business tripping. Cleaning is a breeze. To get the best quality brew I recommend you buy good beans and grind them fresh. Try some Folgers then right away try some quality fresh ground beans either local or black rifle coffee. You’ll taste the difference or at least I did and can’t allow myself to buy the red tub anymore. Stay caffeinated my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Allen Ingram

customer_reviews.title: Worth the investment so camping + home
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on reviews and discussions on various hiking/backpacking blogs and I was not disappointed. Easy to use, light weight, easy to clean and store. It makes a really good cup of coffee too (very important). I love the kit, but leave the stirrer, scoop, stand, and filters holder at home to minimize weight when backpacking. You can pre-measure the coffee and put that into a snack bag along with filters.
customer_reviews.author: campingirl

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and clean. Great quality coffee.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty slick device for varying grind size, water temp, and extraction time. Still experimenting but love the high quality end product. The only downside is that it only makes single cup. Probably for the best because larger Aeropress would be cumbersome.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Coffee
customer_reviews.text: Pros: its so well thought out it hurts. too easy to clean. far to simple to brew a perfect cup of coffee Cons: its kind small so it only brews the perfect amount to fill any mug with a little milk. what am i saying though, who drinks decaf, more coffee at a time would freak me out.
customer_reviews.author: tristan

customer_reviews.title: The AeroPress has changed my life!
customer_reviews.text: I love this coffeemaker so much. I used to have a Bialetti but couldn't be bothered to set aside the time it takes to use it. The AeroPress is much simpler and quicker. It's perfect for my household because my better half and I prefer different kinds of coffee, so we can each whip up a cup of our preferred brew in no time. I love that it cleans up super easily. I've had it for almost a year now, and have had no issues with the device. It still works as great as the day I got it. I can't recommend it enough.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: With just one sip...
customer_reviews.text: We were just occasional coffee people and I was tired of how much space our coffee maker took up on the counter. When I discovered the AeroPress, I watched a LOT of YouTube videos and read a bunch of Amazon Reviews on it, then took a chance and ordered one because it was described so positively by nearly everyone. I originally thought it would just be something that would let us offer coffee to guests while taking up a tiny space in our cupboard the rest of the time. We tried it out and became coffee people! Our AeroPress gets used nearly every day - and we have given away our plug-in coffee maker!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best coffee I have ever tasted!
customer_reviews.text: I am a proud owner of two Aeropresses and I hate to say it, but it has ruined coffee outside of the aeropress for me! The taste is so rich and smooth, it cannot be beat. My only criticism is that it is difficult to make multiple cups (we like ours Americano style, where you put hot water on top of the expresso you make). That is solved pretty easily - buy a second one!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Beck

customer_reviews.title: Superior coffee bean taste aroma
customer_reviews.text: Most people don’t really seem to enjoy the actual taste of coffee: a doctorate up with all kinds of stuff in order to obliterate the coffee bean taste. If you happen to be a true coffee lover, taste aroma been etc. you’ll be getting a vastly superior cuppa coffee without the muss and fuss
customer_reviews.author: econPROF

customer_reviews.title: Wow.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize I was drinking bitter coffee all my life, this thing really is great. I own an espresso machine, this low-tech apparatus does it better. Super easy to clean, about as fast as my fiancés instant coffee.
customer_reviews.author: timothy

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a gift for my best friend, who is an avid coffee drinker, after I saw my roommate using hers. My best friend lives in a studio apartment where space is limited and this product ended up being a perfect addition! It took some time and watching some videos on youtube before he figured the best way to brew his coffee to fit his specific taste (inverted method), but since he figured that out he loves it! Everything came as promised, as I am even considering buying one for myself as I travel often.
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne jordan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value and the best coffee maker available.
customer_reviews.text: With 2 packages of filters and a bag to put everything in, this Aeropress kit is a great value. The Aeropress makes the smoothest, best tasting coffee that I have ever had. This kit makes it a great value too.
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: Throw away your 20th century coffee maker.
customer_reviews.text: A grinder, hot water, Aeropress, and beans. Forget everything else. Welcome to the future of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt M.

customer_reviews.title: Aeropress makes "America" coffee even better!
customer_reviews.text: Once you go Aeropress you can't go back... I stopped buying Starbooks and starting buying Black Riffle coffee instead. I felt like there was a better way to drink the best coffee ever made in America so I got an Aeropress. HOLY COW ITS AMAZING!!! Personally, I like to grind my coffee into expresso dust when making my coffee for the best results. With the carry bag I take it to work and all my coworkers who drink coffee loved it.
customer_reviews.author: foxandrosie

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use and Excellent Coffee
customer_reviews.text: I was on a Yosemite hiking trip and my friend broke out his AeroPress Coffee maker. Not only was the coffee very easy to make, it was absolutely great tasting. I purchased it on my phone as soon as I had a single data bar, and was at my doorstep as soon as I got home. I've watched a number of different youtube videos of folks using their AeroPress to create the perfect cup of coffee, and I would advise everyone do the same for some marvelous techniques. All in all, I am so happy with my purchase. It's now part of my daily routine and I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: Blending power? What is that. Anyway this makes great coffee in undera minute. I would go for the one without the bag. It comes with a few extras that aren't needed, but great product.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby B

customer_reviews.title: Retiree's Dream
customer_reviews.text: My husband found this on You Tube and really wanted it. He's retired and has its of play time so we are now it's proud owners. It actually makes great coffee and you don't get all of the coffee build up that you get in regular coffee makers. No grounds in your coffee, easy clean etc. I think it takes extra time to make the coffee, but as he makes the coffee, what do I care. He's happy with it and I get a great cup of coffee. Great for camping too. No messy pots to clean. Lightweight and comes with it's own carry bag. Nice for people who only want that 1 cup of coffee a day.
customer_reviews.author: momofgus

customer_reviews.title: No complaints here
customer_reviews.text: I went on a 7 day backpacking/camping trip last summer and one of my friends brought the aeropress along. It's simple, sturdy, lightweight, and easy to use. If you plan on bringing it in a backpack you won't need some of the extra accessories (scoop, mixer, etc.) but they are a nice addition to the package. It also pairs up perfectly with a jet boil for coffee anywhere. I bought myself one this week and look forward to using it during ski season and hiking season alike.
customer_reviews.author: Terence J.

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: I bought this upon the recommendation of a real coffee loving friend. The brewing is fast, clean, efficient and oh so tasty. Cleanup is very easy as well. Usually it requires no more than a good rinse after each use. It comes with two extra pieces which are not thoroughly explained in the limited directions. I thought they were just needless plastic packing materials to keep the shape of the package. It turns out that the one funnel shaped piece actually is a funnel for pouring freshly ground beans into the main chamber without spilling. Unfortunately the other piece I threw away which I read elsewhere is to be used to store the circular filters. Oops.
customer_reviews.author: Magic

customer_reviews.title: would not buy again
customer_reviews.text: cuppa was tasty. easy to use. but the plunger seal wore out really quickly. maybe after about 60 uses, the edge peeled and broke away causing small leaks at first which quickly because sprays of hot water right at the hand pushing the plunger. I know replacement seals are available but I’m gonna pass. This just isn’t durable enough.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super easy & Delicious Coffee
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use, so easy to clean. Find some tips on YouTube if u want your coffee a little (or a lot) stronger than the initial instructions detail. This thing is great.
customer_reviews.author: DesertJones15

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye drip machine!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Taste great and easy to clean. The only con with this is that it only produces 8oz at a time. I usually drink twenty at a time. So doing this twice is worth it. This made me transition from sugary creamy coffee to black real easy and amazing. Very pleased! Now I just have to find a cheap setup to boil water for camping!
customer_reviews.author: mckenna

customer_reviews.title: Woah.
customer_reviews.text: Best coffee ever. It is easy to use and it removes any harsh bitterness from a good cup of joe. I wish you could purchase a solid stainless steel version but in the meantime I love this one!
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Laine

customer_reviews.title: Good Product.
customer_reviews.text: OK so I gave this product a rather negative review earlier, two stars. But I went ahead and bought another one. If you make your grind too fine you'll run into problems pushing the piston through the cylinder and prematurely wear out the cylinder. That is precisely what happened to my first one. It lasted less than a year. Now that I am using a medium coarse grind the thing seems to work just fine and produces a decent cup of coffee. At least I like it and the price seems about right. Don't kid yourself into thinking this is an expresso machine because it isn't but it does make a cup of coffee that I enjoy drinking.
customer_reviews.author: John T. Turner

customer_reviews.title: Neat...
customer_reviews.text: I like that this is so easy to assemble, use, clean, and pack away! I'd certainly use it in a hotel room etc. The ratio is hit or miss and that can be a tad frustrating. I do like that the coffee comes out very "clean" though even if you make it quite strong. I haven't found it useful for home use when multiple people all want coffee at the same time though, but, that's why I have a french press and drip coffee maker!
customer_reviews.author: Cameron S

customer_reviews.title: Came Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: One of the coffee nerds at work recommended this brand. I was looking for a coffee-related gift for my wife for her birthday. We can use this when we are camping as an alternative to instant coffee. GREAT product.
customer_reviews.author: Heather K. & Tim B.

customer_reviews.title: Purchased second unit for replacement parts
customer_reviews.text: The AeroPress makes the best cup of coffee. I found that a quality burr grinder will give you the best results. I ordered this because I needed the strainer cap to replace my original that went missing. Unfortunately, the new cap has changed slightly from my first one. The old cap would retain the filter paper perfectly because of the close tolerance fit. The new cap has a larger inside diameter and the filter paper sits loosely inside. This would be fine for the normal brewing process, but I prefer to use the inverted process. So now I have to wet the filter first so it will adhere to the cap while installing on the chamber.
customer_reviews.author: Yrag

customer_reviews.title: Best Cuppa Joe Ever
customer_reviews.text: I've been a fan of this wonderful gadget since discovering it last year--so much so that I keep giving them to friends as gifts. Though I wouldn't consider myself a connesirs...conneiusr..connoiser....uh, an expert on coffee, but I do know what I like and that's coffee free of excessive oils, bitterness and foreign aftertaste. The AeroPress makes all of that a thing of the past. And pressing my own cup of coffee allows me to get in some morning exercise before breakfast!
customer_reviews.author: James D. Long

customer_reviews.title: Awesome coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: Love this portable espresso machine. Watch a YouTube video if you need some help figuring it out. We travel a lot for work and it's great to be able to make your own espresso on the go. Everything fits perfectly in the supplied carry bag too. If you're a fan of a good espresso and like to do the DIY thing then get one of these.
customer_reviews.author: LVDV

customer_reviews.title: Since I have use the aero press it is the only Way to drink coffee.
customer_reviews.text: Works great easy to use handy to take with you anywhere you go always able to make a fresh cup of coffee Now that I have used this coffee does not taste good any other way.
customer_reviews.author: Earthchild

customer_reviews.title: Low cost + high quality = great coffee press!
customer_reviews.text: After years of drinking coffee from the K----- coffee makers, this past Thanksgiving my dad ruined me for that stuff with some freshly ground Kenyan AA brewed in his AeroPress. I had no idea I could get such a good cup of coffee so economically! So, an Amazon Prime order later, and I'm now the owner of my own AeroPress and a Hario Ceramic Coffee Mill, and am on the hunt for which beans will become my go-to morning cuppa.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Newby

customer_reviews.title: Awesome coffee maker!
customer_reviews.text: As for the AeroPress itself, hands down the best portable, lightweight travel coffee maker on the planet. The bag that comes with this package deal...not worth the $2 extra.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney

customer_reviews.title: The Best Coffee and Simplest to Use
customer_reviews.text: I am not a coffee drinker, I prefer Tea...however I take this camping and I have had hard-core coffee drinkers comment that the AeroPress coffee is the best they have tasted...simple to use and clean, I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: fargozombie

customer_reviews.title: I love it.
customer_reviews.text: I just want a single cup of coffee in the morning. So an entire pot of coffee is too much. This is exactly what I need. I have had it for months and it still works great. I expect years of use. You have to boil the water at the right temperature. The temperature of the water can be judged by the size of bubble in the pot. Look it up on the internet it is easy for anyone to understand. If you heat up the water too much the coffee will taste bitter. Follow instructions on box, don't clean in dishwasher, enjoy. I recommend this product. Please click "Yes" below if you found this review helpful!
customer_reviews.author: Josh Bartman

customer_reviews.title: Leaks after a few weeks.
customer_reviews.text: Makes great coffee but the seal fails and leaks after just a couple weeks. The storage bag is cheaply made. I bought this one because the picture doesn't show the useless funnel and stirrer so I thought they left them out and sent it with a nice storage bag instead. Wrong! They include those and a very low-quality storage bag.
customer_reviews.author: Snooty

customer_reviews.title: Better 5han expected
customer_reviews.text: I had read all of the reviews and listened to my coffee snob brother’s raves about it before buying it. It more than measures up to the build-up. If you want a full, rich cup of coffee with no regrets this is for you.
customer_reviews.author: John M Chitty

customer_reviews.title: Best cup of coffee ever!
customer_reviews.text: This, hands down, makes the best cup of coffee I've ever had. My husband and I tested this next to other coffee brewing methods and this makes the coffee taste so smooth and even takes out the bitterness you get from other brewing methods. The trick is to make sure the water temp is between 165-170 F. We love it so much we have sent it out as gifts! Totally worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Janelle Dudoit

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, even compared with a siphon!
customer_reviews.text: I have been experimental with my coffee lately, and the aeropress has been a staple in my daily routine. I also purchased a siphon not long after, highly regarded as one of the best brewing methods, and while the aeropress is a fraction of the price of a siphon, the brew certainly holds its ground! Tremendous what this little tube can do!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Obermayer

customer_reviews.title: It makes a great cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: You know, I really like this from the standpoint of what it does. Great coffee. But, it's cumbersome. I just find myself reaching for a Vue Cup for the Keurig Vue because it's so fast and easy and you know, I like the taste. I'm not a coffee snob. I thought I was which is why I got this and I'm just not. I love coffee. All kinds of coffee and I just find myself not interested in using this as much as I thought I would. If you love the process of making coffee, this is for you. Involved every step of the way. Most of the time, I just want a cup and go.
customer_reviews.author: Nope

customer_reviews.title: this cannot be beat for coffee lovers.
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves coffee. I mean LOVES coffee. I read up on how to brew the perfect cup and this is the cleverest little gadget to get the job done. Easy to use and easy to clean especially for the family with a one-coffee drinker who gets up earlier than the rest. We even take this with camping. In the morning we start a propane burner and heat up his water in a tin pan, in minutes he has a premium brewed cup of java. Be sure to buy fine ground for espresso.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Green

customer_reviews.title: If you like Great Coffee, Use This
customer_reviews.text: I love this!! I'm kind of picky when it come to my coffee. I've been grinding my own beans for years and have a quality coffee maker but this change it. I get the smoothest cup of coffee. It always tastes good and is so easy to use and clean up. The coffee maker is on the shelf now and has not been used since the AeroPress arrived. It's very easy to pack on trips as well. I bring ground coffee with me and can always get hot water at the hotel so I know I can always have a great cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Guitarplayerbp

customer_reviews.title: So many choices of coffee to use with this type of coffee maker.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had my Aeropress for 2 1/2 years, still working great. After using this product for a week I had come to the conclusion that I’ve been drinking swill my whole life. And I’ll never buy an electric coffee maker as long as I live especially one of those high dollar k-cup gadgets.
customer_reviews.author: splendora01

customer_reviews.title: BEST COFFEE
customer_reviews.text: I've changed my view of what is good coffee because of this. It is pretty amazing and I recommend it for anyone who is interested in a good cup of coffee. Don't follow the directions that comes with the maker, use the inverted method you will find everyone using on YouTube.
customer_reviews.author: STLITPro

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee ever!
customer_reviews.text: I love the aero press so much that I've given them as gifts. Great coffee in minutes. The instructions recommend making coffee with water at 175 degrees; it's more flavorful without the acid. Because I dislike having to keep a supply of filters around, I purchased a reusable gold filter. It works great. I also love that I don't have to have a maker sitting on the counter.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: ... had my AeroPress for a week now and absolutely love it. No more pour overs or French presses ...
customer_reviews.text: I had my AeroPress for a week now and absolutely love it. No more pour overs or French presses for me. I can now make fantastic coffee. It's hard to explain how much better my coffee tastes now....really a night and day difference. Cons: the plastic is a little too dark which makes it hard to see the fill lines.
customer_reviews.author: c copple

customer_reviews.title: Coffee anytime, great product, convenience and it works
customer_reviews.text: Great for trips, deployments, camping or any time you want coffee without the hassle. All items fit in a small bag that you can bring with you during travel, the coffee is fresh pressed and fresh. No issues at all with this product, it was recommended to my by a friend who swears by it. I have no used it to make espresso but I had no reason to believe it will not meet my expectations. I would highly recommend this product to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Team Kue

customer_reviews.title: This coffee maker does not make a less acidic cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product because of all the press release about how it makes a cup of coffee with 1/5th the acid. This could not be further from the truth. I purchased a digital acid tester and brewed 3 different coffee brands using my regular coffee makjer and this one and in every case, my regular coffee maker made a less acidic cup of coffee. I blew $40 on this ripoff.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Coffee Ever.  Especially for Hiking.
customer_reviews.text: This is seriously the best coffee maker I have ever used. I bought with the intention of using it for hiking and camping, but I've already made several cups at home. It makes the perfect size single cup. I used to have to use 2-5 scoops of coffee to get the strength and flavor the Aeropress makes with a single smaller scoop. If you are hiking or camping this is a must have addition to your pack. It smaller than your cookware set, and if you wanted to get the metal screen filter (which I probably will) you can make your clean up even more environmental when on the trail.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on the advice of a friend after my personal sized french press broke. This is infinitely better than any french press I've used and very easy to clean and store.
customer_reviews.author: Moth77

customer_reviews.title: Takes more storage space that I have
customer_reviews.text: Makes great coffee, easy to use. I bought it to use in my small RV. I wish it were designed in a way to store in a smaller package. Space is limited in the RV, I will likely continue to use my collapsing pour over
customer_reviews.author: Jefsdon

customer_reviews.title: The best cup of Joe
customer_reviews.text: Simply the best coffee method for a single cup. Get yourself a bean grinder and play around with technique. Once your there you will do it everyday. So consistently good.
customer_reviews.author: GZ

customer_reviews.title: Best Coffee Maker EVER!
customer_reviews.text: The Aeropress Coffee & Espresso Maker is my go to coffee maker. I use it almost every morning. The coffee that it produces is the least acidic I have personally come across. I thoroughly enjoy using this product and recommend it to everyone. It is also compact and light enough to take with you on trips. You can purchase a rubber top to even utilize the inside of the press as a storage compartment for grinds on the go.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth type of coffee press and by far the one I like the best. I went from not being a coffee drinker to being very picky. I like to buy the whole bean type and grind myself for a fresher, more delicious cup of coffee. This one works great!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel M.

customer_reviews.title: God's Gift to Coffee Lovers
customer_reviews.text: At home, we have a Keurig for convenience, a moka pot for espresso drinks, and and AeroPress for cups of good coffee on the weekends. After doing some trial and error with methods, I settled on one that makes the perfect cup of strong, non-acidic coffee for my taste. This isn't a device for people in a rush. It's for people who don't mind spending 5 mins more on quality. Cleanup is a breeze and the filters are dirt cheap. The filter and puck of spent grounds can easily be ejected into our countertop composting bin, which is a nice bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Mexico

customer_reviews.title: Use it every day
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a $2500 Jura Capressa that my ex-husband kept when we divorced. I didn't have the money to purchase one of my own, so I thought I would try this instead. I've been very happy with the results. I had to use it several times before understanding the flavor is all in the "gentle" pressure applied to the plunger. Don't rush it and it's just as good as a shot of Starbuck's espresso -or a JC. I've had it about a month and it is great for travel, too. I like an iced venti Americano, with 3 shots of esperesso, and iced latte's, too. This has been wonderful for both!
customer_reviews.author: LinDee

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little coffee press!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how I survived mornings without this amazing little coffee press. Exactly the right size for making a single cup of rich, strong coffee. I add water to the concentrated coffee this makes for my morning cup. It's important to grind the beans extra fine. I've tried tossing in my housemates' normal-grind beans when I'm out of coffee and the result is just not the same. For iced coffee. I brew the coffee concentrate pour it over ice, without adding extra water. Mmmm, coffee... I think I'm going to go make myself a cup right now.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Sayre

customer_reviews.title: Totally Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I was never really a coffee connoisseur until this last year. I'm a one really good strong cup a day type person. This device is perfect for that type. You can get the most out of your gourmet beans as It makes a potent cup of mud without all of the sediment left behind like a traditonal french press. Clean up is a cinch. You just push the grounds through it and out the bottom then rinse the plunger. For someone else who's a multi-cup a day type, I don't know if you want to keep making them a la carte but if you did, the results are always spot on.
customer_reviews.author: RaoulDuque

customer_reviews.title: Not used for coffee. But and excellent filter.
customer_reviews.text: I have not used this to make coffee. I feel like this is important to mention as I cannot attest to this product's coffee making ability. However I purchased this to use as a filter when making cocktail bitters, and it has worked excellently. It'll be easier to look the process up yourself if you're interested, but without going into details, the filters included did a great job of catching a very fine residual byproduct I was trying to remove. I burned through filters but it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Will R.

customer_reviews.title: Good times!
customer_reviews.text: It's everything it claims to be. Makes great coffee, crazily easy to clean, and if you buy this particular package it comes with so many filters that you might not ever run out. I don't find the bag to be very useful personally, but the rest of it is totally cool. I should mention that one of my favorite things about this coffee maker is how much you can experiment. I've tried all sorts of things, like putting milk directly into the chamber, or sugar, or Kahlua, or anything else. There are many possibilities here beyond just simple coffee making that people have yet to discover, I think.
customer_reviews.author: Alex W.

customer_reviews.title: Warning! Your coffee bill will go up (because it tastes so good)
customer_reviews.text: I came across a mention of this from author Tim Ferriss, and fell in love with the ease and quality of the brew. I have been using K-cups for some time, but the selection and price were getting to me. Luckily this provides a perfect alternative, and the best primary espresso tool for me from now on. Very easy to use, super easy dumping grounds (just pop out into the trash) and then rinse. The only downside is how I can easily end up drinking 8-10 shots across 3-5 lattes in one morning, and burn through a bag of coffee. That's due to the taste, not efficiency!
customer_reviews.author: W. E. Beck

customer_reviews.title: It does make a good cup of joe but I like to have 2 ...
customer_reviews.text: It is a neat idea but I bought a cheap electric coffee maker as it is easier. I am not a connoisseur of coffee. It does make a good cup of joe but I like to have 2 cups oftentimes. I also find that the rubber plunger seems loose to me - they offered to replace if I sent it back but I let it go and will see how long it lasts. So long so good-who knew?
customer_reviews.author: Tozzy

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't have traveled without it
customer_reviews.text: Ok so you are in France, Italy or Spain and want a big cup of strong coffee, where do you get it? Nowhere unless you have this press or can find a Starbucks. I like my coffee big, strong, and with milk. Sure you can get strong coffee in other countries, but its 2 oz at a time, a double is 4 oz. See the photo for the biggest coffee I could order for breakfast in Milan. Get the press! forgo packing those extra shoes!
customer_reviews.author: hawaiidream'in

customer_reviews.title: Drip coffee is ruined for me
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love the Aeropress. It makes the best tasting coffee. I received this as a gift for Mother's Day shortly after moving into a new apartment and have yet to buy a drip maker because the Aeropress makes such good coffee, even though it doea require a little extra effort. The only complaint I have is that it is sometimes harder to press than others. That may be the type of cup or the way the press is inserted into the tube. But regardless I think it's a great buy for any coffee lover.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Don't follow the instructions, do research and experiment and you'll find what works best for you.
customer_reviews.text: There coffee it makes is silky smooth! I definitely disagree with the manufacturer about being method though. It says to use 185 degree water. Use 200-205, just under boiling, for best results. I tried 185 several times and the coffee was almost a little sour or metallic tasting. The hotter water produced a much better product with the same grounds. Best brewing method I've found is from Black Rifle Coffee's YouTube video about the Aeropress. Great product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rojahn Family

customer_reviews.title: You're looking at one terrific cup if coffee
customer_reviews.text: I own one. Love it. Simple to use. Quick. BPA free and a cinch to clean. Outstanding cup of coffee. You will not be disappointed. I also gave one as a gift since I was so pleased. They love it. Make sure to have your coffee ground a bit finer than drip. If its too fine the thing is near impossible to push. There are plenty of youtube video demonstrations. Oh....its great as it comes but you can get permanent filters for more ease and cleaner flavor. There are a couple different brands on Amazon. Mine rinses clean easily. Like icing on the cake.
customer_reviews.author: DianaruTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Very good kit. If you reuse your filters
customer_reviews.text: Very good kit. If you reuse your filters, these will last a long time. The case is convenient, even will fit a small hand grinder in it. Aeropress is a convenient and cool way to get good flavor from your coffee. If you are like me, though, nothing can replace a good shot of espresso. I use this on a daily basis and only visit coffee roasters to get beans and espresso shots now.
customer_reviews.author: Andreea

customer_reviews.title: Way better than the disgusting swill at the office
customer_reviews.text: I got this to have in the office and man what a difference. I actually prefer it to a keurig cup which I have at home. Now I want one for home, too... I seem to have a pretty easy time getting it all set up and actually making a cup. I can usually do the entire process from filling to pressing to cleanup in about the same time somebody can plop a crap-cup in the automatic brown water dispenser into a styrofoam cup of cancer. Others with less manual dexterity, physical fortitude, or mental endurance may have mixed opinions.
customer_reviews.author: Tbone

customer_reviews.title: tl;dr The best and balanced way for one or two cups of coffe, but past that it gets less viable.
customer_reviews.text: My favorite method now. I used to think an oily cup of coffee with a french press was the ultimate experience, but honestly Aeropress tastes so damn clean and preserves key oils in the coffee that it's hard to compete cup for cup with ANY brewing method. for larger batches though, Aeropress becomes less and less viable.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Quick, great tasting coffee
customer_reviews.text: As a frequent sufferer of heartburn, I can definitely tell a difference in the acidity. To validate their claim: with manual drip coffee I will have heartburn about an hour later and with a french press heartburn is almost instantaneous for me. I always use the espresso method and typically mix 1:1 with dark chocolate almond milk to make a mocha and will occasionally drink the coffee straight.
customer_reviews.author: agent_phosgene

customer_reviews.title: "Haha, yea Jan, it's just coffee--not rocket science"
customer_reviews.text: It makes a great cup of coffee. The only two downsides I see are that it only makes one cup at a time, and your coworkers will endlessly make the same stupid joke about "coffee experiments" that you really can't handle politely because you haven't had your coffee yet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Second Aeropress used for traveling
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase for Aeropress. I bought it for travel use. The coffee tastes just as good as if going out to buy from any coffee shop. I use Cafe Bustelo coffee with 1/2 & 1/2.
customer_reviews.author: rand

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and good coffee
customer_reviews.text: I'll caveat this with the fact that I am the only coffee drinker in my household...if you're looking to make an equivalent amount to a large pot of coffee this could be a lot of work. I bought this to replace my Keurig brewer, which was awesome but died after years of use. A friend with (with a much better palate than me) swore by his Aeropress. I figured I couldn't go wrong considering this cost 1/10th what a new Keurig would. I couldn't be happier with my purchase. I make sure to rinse the filters before I use them and I usually re-use them at least three times. Totally worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gift for my husband, and he loved it.
customer_reviews.text: My husband is kind of a "coffee nerd," and this was on his wish list, so I gave it to him for his birthday. He loves it. He says it's the best cup of coffee he's ever made. It's a bit more work than, say, popping a Keurig cup into the machine, but it's not so complicated and messy that one would give up using it after a few cups. He has used his pretty much every day since he got it on May 4. It is very easy to clean - large, uncomplicated pieces rinse easily - and we love the storage bag to keep all the pieces and the filters together.
customer_reviews.author: mikki925

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I've been enjoying this AeroPress every day for quite a while now and it's still going strong! The rubber seal on the plunger still works as great as the day I first got this product and cleanup is always a breeze. This product is incredibly well designed and I know I'll continue to use it for a long time to come.
customer_reviews.author: G. Martin

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product! It is small enough with a bag ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product! It is small enough with a bag for travel and can be used anywhere. Bought this for my husband that is a "coffee snob" and travels regularly. Recommend if you like good coffee and don't want to pay high prices.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Baer

customer_reviews.title: Great for travelling.
customer_reviews.text: The Aeropress made me great coffee during my cross country train trip (though one suggestion is to make your coffee only during train stops, unless you want a challenge). Cleanup was as simple as wiping up any coffee residue from the plunger and surrounding area. It being plastic also made me not have to worry too much about throwing it in my backpack during travel.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: AeroPress Espresso Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: This is the second set that we bought because we were very impressed with the first set that we bought a few months ago. We needed to keep the second Aeropress espresso coffee maker in our second home in Singapore so we do not have bring the first set back and forth from USA. The product speaks for itself, the espresso coffee always turn out fabulous. We do not have to make a purpose trip or spend more money at a special coffee outlet. One cup of espresso coffee using the Aeropress is enough to brighten my husband's day.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Lee

customer_reviews.title: Better than a Keurig!
customer_reviews.text: We ditched our Keurig once we got this! Now we can easily have our own coffee wherever we are with ease!
customer_reviews.author: SCH

customer_reviews.title: EASY to clean and great coffee
customer_reviews.text: I really like this! I was looking into a French press but when I saw this I knew it was worth a try. I've had it for a month. Took a couple tries to get the brew right but I don't know a lot about coffee. My third cup was awesome. It works best with fine grounds. The thing I like best though is that it is EASY to clean. When you are done just twist the cap off and push the pump the rest of the way and our come the grounds and filter. Then just wash. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

product_meta.title: AeroPress Coffee and Espresso Maker with Tote Bag and 350 Additional Filters - Quickly Makes Delicious Coffee Without Bitterness - 1 to 3 Cups Per Press
product_meta.description: Popular with coffee enthusiasts worldwide, the patented AeroPress is a new kind of coffee press that uses a rapid, total immersion brewing process to make smooth, delicious, full flavored coffee without bitterness and with low acidity. Good-bye French Press! The rapid brewing AeroPress avoids the bitterness and high acidity created by the long steep time required by the French press. Plus, the AeroPress paper Microfilter eliminates grit and means clean up takes seconds. Makes 1 to 3 cups of American coffee per pressing in about a minute, and unlike a French press, it can also brew espresso style coffee for use in lattes, cappuccinos and other espresso based drinks. Perfect for home kitchen use, the AeroPress is lightweight, compact, portable and durable. The tote bag makes it easy to pack with some coffee and a cup for use while traveling, camping, backpacking, boating and more! Includes the AeroPress press, funnel, scoop, stirrer, 700 microfilters, a filter holder, and a zippered nylon tote bag. Phthalate free and BPA free. Mug not included. Assembled measurements: 9 1/2" h X 4" w X 4" d
feature_bullets: Popular with coffee enthusiasts worldwide, the patented AeroPress is a new kind of coffee press that uses a rapid, total immersion brewing process to make smooth, delicious, full flavored coffee without bitterness and with low acidity.

Good-bye French Press! The rapid brewing AeroPress avoids the bitterness and high acidity created by the long steep time required by the French press. Plus, the AeroPress paper Microfilter eliminates grit and means clean up takes seconds.
Makes 1 to 3 cups of American coffee per pressing in about a minute, and unlike a French press, it can also brew espresso style coffee for use in lattes, cappuccinos and other espresso based drinks.

Perfect for home kitchen use, the AeroPress is lightweight, compact, portable and durable. The tote bag makes it easy to pack with some coffee and a cup for use while traveling, camping, backpacking, boating and more!

Includes the AeroPress press, funnel, scoop, stirrer, 700 microfilters, a filter holder, and a zippered nylon tote bag. Phthalate free and BPA free. Mug not included. Assembled measurements: 9 1/2" h X 4" w X 4" d
